Name: Physics by Inquiry: An Introduction to Physics and the Physical Sciences, Vol. 2 (Volume 2)

ReviewList.Text: I have used parts of this curriculum with middle school and high school students over the past fifteen years, after having taken the summer training course for teachers.  The curriculum is engaging and hands-on, with students required to build their own knowledge and understanding in order to learn.  That said, this is not a book that a teacher can just pick up and start teaching out of--you really have to do the activities yourself in order to understand them, so it is a commitment, but one that is well worth it.  There are a wide variety of modules to choose from, including optics, motion, and astronomy.  This also works best in a small class, as the teacher has to check in with students frequently to make sure they understand what they are doing.  If you have the opportunity to teach from this curriculum, your students will be very lucky indeed.
